content:
Huge in Germany, not so big in Denmark

GERMANS call them Rabenmütter (“raven mothers”)—women who work so hard outside the home that they barely have time for their children. It is meant as an insult. The opposite is a Gluckenmutter (“hen mother”), who dotes on her children as a hen dotes on her eggs. This is hardly complimentary, either. Whatever mothers do, it seems, they are expected to feel guilty about it.

They also face a wage penalty as soon as they give birth. This is largely because mothers choose to work fewer hours, or in lower-paid but more child-friendly jobs, or not at all when their children are very young. A new academic paper tries to measure this effect. It defines the motherhood penalty as the amount by which women’s earnings fall compared with their earnings a year before giving birth. (It includes the non-existent earnings of women who give up work entirely.) It finds that the motherhood penalty exists in all six countries studied—but varies greatly in size.

It was largest in Germany: after ten years, a typical mother was earning 61% less than she was before she gave birth. In Austria the penalty was a hefty 51%. It was somewhat smaller, at about 40%, in America and Britain, and smallest in Sweden (27%) and Denmark (21%). Men’s earnings in all countries were largely unaffected by parenthood.

The study found that the motherhood penalty was biggest for mothers whose own mother had stayed at home when they were children, as these were the most likely to follow their example and also stay at home.

Public policy also accounts for some of the difference. Sweden requires firms to offer 12 months of parental leave per child, split evenly between the two parents, with three months reserved for the father. If he does not take it, it is lost. This is perhaps why Swedish men see a small dip in their earnings after becoming fathers—they take more paternity leave than American or German men do. However, after three months they tend to go back to work, leaving their wives with the nappies and the carrot-flavoured mush.

The motherhood penalty was largest in countries where more people tell pollsters that women should stay at home with the kids—presumably because in such countries, they are more likely to do so. At the current rate of change, the World Economic Forum estimates that it will be 202 years before men and women achieve parity in the workforce.

ex: adj. 赠送的；称赞的；问候的
n. 游一游；泡一泡；（通常指暂时的）减少；凹陷处
v. 蘸；浸；（使）下降；把（汽车前灯的）远光调为近光
网络 直插；双列直插(Dual Inline Package)；沉
eg2: He dipped the brush into the paint.
他拿画笔蘸了蘸颜料。
Dip your hand in to see how hot the water is.
把手伸进去看看水有多热。
The fruit had been dipped in chocolate.
这水果蘸过巧克力酱。
The sun dipped below the horizon.
太阳落到地平线下了。
Sales for this quarter have dipped from 38.7 million to 33 million.
本季度销售额从 3 870 万下降到 3 300 万。
The road dipped suddenly as we approached the town.
我们向镇里驶近时道路陡然下斜。
The plane dipped its wings.
机翼向下倾斜。
Let's go for a dip before breakfast.
我们早饭前去游一会儿泳吧。
a sharp dip in profits
利润急剧下降
a dip in the road
路上的凹陷处
Puddles had formed in the dips.
低洼处形成了一个个水坑。
A brief dip into history serves to confirm this view.
随便翻阅一下历史就足以证实这种观点。
He gave a dip of his head.
他点了点头。

eg2: I estimate the damage at 8000 yuan.
我估计那项损失达8000元。
You had better countercheck that last .
你最好复核一下上次的估价。
The committee lacked a correct estimate of his ability.
委员会对他的能力缺乏正确的评价。

ex: n. 生存者；存在的事物

eg2: But they are non- if we give up before we have started.
但是，如果我们开始前就放弃了，这些机会是不存在的。
In some cases, the corresponding IT Governance is non- or weak, and it is then necessary to do some of the governance work that should have already completed.
在某些情况下，相应的 IT 治理是不存在的，或者非常薄弱，那么就有必要进行一些本应该已经完成的治理工作。
The only problem with this solution is that, occasionally, autocreating non- subdirectories is exactly the wrong thing to do.
这个解决方案唯一的问题就是，有时，自动创建不存在的子目录真是最不应该做的事情。

eg2: It’s a  sample, with a lot of nurses and pretty good continuity.
这是个非常大的样本，有这么多的护士而且连续性非常的好。
Nearly all of them require hefty financing, which is not easy to find in Washington or in any state capital these days.
几乎所有涉及的计划都需要大量资金，但是最近在华盛顿或任何首府都不容易得到这样的资助。
Over the past month, key foreign firms have agreed to hefty pay hikes for their Chinese employees.
过去一个月，主要的外国公司已经同意为他们的中国雇员大幅度提升工资。

她被他的侮辱激怒了。
What he said stank of .
他所说的话含有侮辱的意味。
I managed to pass off his .
我终于没去理会他的侮辱。

父母之爱深而真挚。

eg2: Increasingly, reaching  against the U.S. dollar is a question of when, not if, and whether it can stay there.
市场越来越觉得,加元兑美元达到平价只是时间和能否保持的问题,而非能否实现的问题.
The costs of each complication were estimated in purchasing power parity dollars (I$) for 2008 and discounted at 3%.
每项并发症的成本以2008年购买力平价美元（$）为单位进行估算，贴现率为3%。
So economists try to smooth out these differences by figuring the size of an economy on a \\\"purchasing power \\\" basis.
为了消除这些差别，经济学家试图通过以“购买力平价”为基础描绘一个国家的经济情况。

ex: n. 父权；父系；父系后裔
eg2: They seem to have subverted a male trick that is intended to ensure  rights, and turned it into a trap.
它们似乎能够识破雄性蜘蛛维护其父权地位的诡计，并将其变成一个陷阱。
"We have never promoted the test for fetal sexing, but some mothers need the  test results for immigration applications and other purposes ...
我们从来没有把该测试用于性别检测，但是有些妈妈为了申请移民或者其他目的，需要父系检测的结果。
But by removing the genetic material of males they consider socially inferior, the hens have managed to retain control of .
但是雌禽通过排出它认为社会地位低下雄禽的遗传物质，设法保留了对父亲身份的控制。

ex: n. 罚款，罚金；处罚
eg2: The fees and penalty charges ballooned.
花费和罚款费用一路激增。
Yes. It's a notice of violation but no civil .
是的，它是一个违规的通知,但是没有民事处罚。
If not, well, I accept the physical penalty without complaint.
就当是毫无怨言地在承受这个肉体上的罚款。

ex: n. 民意测验主办人；民意调查员

eg2: I mean you presumably still have friends and family back in Pakistan.
我的意思是你大概还有朋友和家人在巴基斯坦吧。
So, , if we follow our rules so far only one of these should be correct.
那么，可以假定，如果我们按照之前的规则,应该只有一个是正确的。
She too was not awake, and presumably unaware of others’ presence with her.
她也处于昏迷状态中,大概不知道有人和她在一起。

eg2: The question is small but .
问题虽小， 但很典型。
This painting is a typical Rembrandt.
这幅画是一幅典型的伦勃朗作品。
But, in the more typical case, there will have been parallel changes.
但是，在更加典型的情况下，会有平行变更被检测到。

ex: adj. 不受影响的；自然的；真挚的；不矫揉造作的

wp.- unaffected: 中文意思是自然真挚的

eg2: If you want to have a fighting chance of getting to material that has been unaffected by these processes, it's good to go down.
他补充说，“如果你想有一个能够接触到还没有被这些程序所影响到的物质的机会，那么最好是继续下去。”
The effects of these measures are likely minor relative to the size of  markets but they have a significant negative effect on particular exporters shut out of markets.
这些措施的影响相对于未受影响的市场来说可能不大，但它们对被市场拒之门外的特定出口国家具有严重的负面影响。
They urged other town residents  by the quake and tsunami to do the same.
他们敦促其他没有受到地震和海啸影响的城镇居民也这样做。

ex: vt. 娶…为妻；给…娶妻

eg2: The factory has a 1 000-strong workforce.
这家工厂的职工多达千人。
Two thirds of the workforce is/are women.
职工中的三分之二是妇女。
A quarter of the local workforce is/are unemployed.
本地四分之一的劳动力都失业了。

Title: How big is the wage penalty for mothers?

paperStatistics.title: How big is the wage penalty for mothers?
paperStatistics.desc: Huge in Germany, not so big in Denmark
